cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SE of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast, aiming for southeast Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Pearl River, near Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA (Storm Surge Watch) and Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA to Mouth of the Pearl River LA including Lake Pontchartrain and Metropolitan New Orleans (Hurricane Warning); east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to the MS/AL border (Storm-Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas–Louisiana border eastward through Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤19%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water rise (<3 ft) possible in upper Texas coast, but significant surge not expected at Galveston
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the upper Texas coast beginning this weekend
